str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
